alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 10:50AM CDT until April 09 at 10:36AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PUTNAM...EASTERN WHITESIDE...NORTHEASTERN HENRY... SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL AND BUREAU COUNTIES... At 1050 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Normandy, or 14 miles south of Rock Falls, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Walnut around 1055 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Ohio, Kasbeer, Van Orin and La Moille. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
